123221.content:
It was the dead of night in the kingdom of Nohr, meaning it was when the country was the most awake. Thieves, thugs, liars and cheats. All roaming the streets doing whatever they may please. King Garon didn’t bother with proper law enforcement after all, typically just executing people if they caused too much trouble and have it be done with. Speaking of whom, the king was currently out of castle krackenburg. Something about heading to a dragon temple of sorts, something he demanded he go alone for. Well, alone and with Iago. That creep stuck to him wherever he went. For those who’d stayed behind though, it was a blessing. They didn’t have to deal with his schemes and snitching for at least a few days and they could just relax and have fun.

Of course, the first in the royal castle to take advantage of this freedom for fun was princess Elise. She’d found herself running through the hallways with her toys, laughing and playing. Her retainers were struggling to keep up. Leo and Xander did nothing different really, both just training. The younger prince training his mind in the library and the eldest prince training his body in the courtyard. The other royals were having a little tea party in the dining room. Simply chatting about various things, with Camilla making sure to coo at her little brother plenty.

“It’s been so long since the two of us just had a night together. I missed nights like this. You should come sleep with me to make it just like old times” Camilla encouraged. Corrin couldn’t help but blush a little, recalling those days. When he’d been very young, Camilla was immediately who he’d go to if he ever got scared by a nightmare. So he’d actually spent plenty of nights in her room. And she didn’t seem to mind one bit whenever it had happened. She did love her little brother dearly after all. “Big sister... you know I’m much too old for that...” he tried to convince her, but the purple haired woman just shook her head. “Nonsense dear. You’re never to old to look for comfort in big sis...” Camilla encouraged, smiling sweetly. Corrin could only really nod. How could he be mad at her for that? Thus, the two enjoyed their night of talking.

Suddenly though, somebody who was not enjoying their night very much cake barging in. It was prince Leo, who was getting annoyed by a particular tome. He’d been trying to pull off a spell for hours now and just couldn’t get it to work. “Leo? What are you doing here?” Corrin questioned. Leo never attended these little parties, always just getting annoyed by them. “I came here because I knew there was two of you. Now hold still...” The tactician muttered as he placed the magic tome on the table, then placed his, Camilla and Corrin’s palms on the cover. “Dear... whats this about?” The princess questioned, really just confused now. Although she was happy to see another brother.

“Ignaseus... gallaran... pasak... maroaasa!” Leo suddenly yelled. For a brief moment, it seemed as if nothing was happening. But then the tome began to shine brightly! Just as he’d predicted, he needed three dragon veins, not just one. There was just one problem... the light had gotten way bigger than he’d expected! It actually ended up engulfing the entire castle! It had truly been years since anything in Nohr had shined so bright. And when it finally subsided, the spell had worked... sort of.

It was meant to shrink just one person, Niles having been the volunteer. No doubt so he could let the prince play around with him. But instead of shrinking one person and leaving everyone else intact, it had shrunk everyone and left one person at normal size. That person being...
123221.title: Nights in Nohr

1232211.content:
After the large flash of light that could be seen from across the country, things just sort of settled and went quiet. Nothing climactic seemed to have happened, at least not in the eyes of lady Camilla. She blinked a few times after the light, trying to figure out what was going on. “Well brother, that was certainly an... interesting spell. I do hope it didn’t hurt our dear cor... rin...” She mumbled, only to trail off.

The purple haired woman glanced around, looking for her little brothers. “Corrin dearest?” She called out in a bit of a confused tone when she couldn’t see him. The princess then turned her head to try to look at Leo, only to see that he wasn’t there either. “What... is this some kind of prank? Is that what this is?” She asked, clearly sounding annoyed. The busty woman was not the kind of be a fan of pranks. She looked around at all the possible hiding spots in her room, not really seeing anything. But she assumed they were still there.

“Fine. Be that way. I’m going to sleep...” Camilla called out, wanting to make sure they heard her. And they did, loud and clear. Because as it would turn out, they were indeed still in the room. Just a lot... lot... lot smaller. In fact, they weren’t even tall enough to peak out of the carpet. They’d gone down to the minuscule of only about half a centimetre, absolutely puny!

Corrin and Leo were both completely lost in that forest of carpet, not able to see much. But when Camilla stood up to her full height, which was already tall by human standards, they definitely saw her. But they didn’t see their sister. They saw a goddess, towering above into the heavens... and then saw their sister. Seeing nowhere else to go, they started to follow along, although she seemed like she was hesitating

“Well... I could just go to bed... or I could...”
1232211.title: The Bewitching Beauty

choices: Fire emblem Echoes: Shadows of Valentina
1233.title: Latest emblems

choices: Lounging with his bare feet kicked up
123321.content:
Thunder and lightning crashed across the sky, echoing across the valleys of Fodlan. Quite a storm had rolled over parts of the adrestian empire as well as Garreg mach. Winds howled strong enough to blow down trees, rain pouring down so thick one could barely see. Indeed it was a brutal storm. Many were surprised that no sort of natural disaster was occurring, wondering if it was only by the grace of the goddess the storm wasn’t killing them.

Even if it wasn’t dangerous though, that didn’t mean anybody was going outside. It would be extremely easy to get sick if anyone tried to go out. Thus, in an effort to keep the students of the officer’s academy safe, they had a day off of school today. Of course, they couldn’t leave their dorms either, but they didn’t have to work. Manuela definitely wouldn’t be able to handle 50 or more sick kids at once after all. And for the most part, this all seemed to work fine. The students stayed in their rooms, with a staff member bringing them all meals. It seemed like it was going to just be a slow, stormy day... until one teacher decided to ask a favour of her students...

———

“Sorry... you want us to ...what?” Felix asked once again, still unable to believe what he’d just heard. At the moment, he, Dimitri and Ingrid had been gathered in Professor Eisner’s office. She wasn’t their teacher, but had still requested they come there anyways. She needed them for something. “I said I want to shrink you all down, head into Sylvain’s room and grab some papers for me” Byleth said completely void of emotion as if that were a perfectly normal sentence she’d just stated. The three students just couldn’t believe she would ask something like this.

“Why do you even want us to do this? And why us specifically?” Ingrid questioned. Although she had a feeling it was because of something stupid Sylvain did. “Well I actually tried to get some other students to help with the task, but none of them have come back yet. So I figure it would likely be best if I sent in his closest friends instead...” Byleth mused, still expressionless. Felix was about to open his mouth again, but the prince stepped in this time. “Well I think we should be able to do this task easily for you, professor!” Dimitri said rather enthusiastically. “Great” Byleth replied, instantly snapping her fingers to magically shrink them down, leaving Felix and Ingrid no time to protest.

She’d made the three barely half a centimetre tall so that they could really go through the room undetected. The teacher scooped the three up in her hands and started to walk through the storm, keeping her grip tight around them to protect them. Once she was by the red head’s room, she crouched down and pushed them all underneath the door. “It’s a paper with blue ink on it” she said simply before just leaving. The three now tiny students barely had time to comprehend anything that had just happened. It had all been so fast.

“Well... we’re stuck doing this now...” Felix grumbled, very clearly annoyed. Ingrid sighed. “Look, if we do it quick it will be over. So let’s just get it over with...” she said, thinking things would be much better if they went fast. And it shouldn’t be too hard to get a single piece of paper, even at this size. The only problem would be Sylvain himself, who was currently...
123321.title: Little Lions

choices: He shot up to 20 feet tall
He shot up to 100 feet tall
123322.content:
(Scenario Requested by a friend)

“I just don’t get it! I eat just as much as you do, then train just as much as you do. But you’re still so much bigger than me!” Caspar complained to his friend. “Well hey, at least you’re healthy, right? Not everyone’s meant to be big, and there’s nothing wrong with that!” Raphael said encouragingly. But the blue haired boy was having trouble being enthusiastic about it.

It was a fairly average day at the Garreg mach officers academy. A few weeks ago, one of the black eagle students Caspar had begun training with a golden deer student, Raphael. The much shorter boy wanted nothing more than to get tall and strong like his new trainer, but nothing he did really added to his form. It was likely a genetic thing, but there was no way to prove that in this age. So instead he just kept trying to train.

Training was over for the day though, making him rather upset. After his friend left, it was just Caspar left in the training grounds, sweaty and tired. He was getting ready to leave, but then he found something. “Huh? A spell book...?” He mumbled, picking it up.

The student flipped through the tome, only to find something quite interesting. “Huh? A growth spell?! Hell yeah!” He yelled, thinking he’d found exactly what he wanted. Caspar wasn’t the greatest at magic or anything, but that wasn’t going to stop him from trying. She he muttered the words, waved his hands and suddenly...
123322.title: Caspar’s big find

1331.title: Dragon Quest 11

13311.content:
(This scenario is going to be taking place after the Calasmos arc of DQ11. Spoilers abound)

It was a late night in Heliodor, but a rather peaceful one. Barely any clouds in the sky, leaving the kingdom to be lit by bright moonlight. And yet despite the peacefulness, monsters still lurked outside of the towns and cities. Many monsters had disappeared after the fall of both Mordegon and Calasmos, but there were still a decent amount of stragglers. It was mostly the likes of slimes, goodybags and platypunks, but a few larger ones did enjoy stalking the night. And one in particular had decided to come out and play.

It was spotted within the foothills just outside of Heliodor’s capital walls. A merchant man had seen a large creature shambling about on his way back into the city. It didn’t take long for the guards to be alerted, as well as some extra help. The great heroes of Erdrea were currently staying in the castle, at the request of Jade’s father, thus they were the ones the guards immediately looked to for aid. Or rather, just the luminary. The great hero’s comrades were all tired and honestly didn’t care enough to gear up for just one monster. Thus they simply let the legendary hero take care of it.

After donning his purple attire and grabbing the sword of light, the Luminary headed on out into the hills with a few royal guards. The only light they had were two torches and the moon. The hero still felt no reason to be afraid though. It wasn’t as if the spectral sentinels were still alive to cause havoc.

The air was nearly still, with only a very light, cool breeze. It put the guards on edge, but the Luminary managed to keep himself level headed. The only sounds were the light chirping of crickets, the clanking of the guards armour and their own footsteps against the grass.

———

They’d searched for nearly a half hour, coming up with absolutely nothing. It was starting to be believed that perhaps the merchant had simply given them a false alarm for the fun of it. Or maybe he’d seen some sort of large, passive animal. Either way, the guards were finally starting to calm down and relax a little... making it The perfect time to strike.

A large silver gilded beast came from the ground, as if it had previously been burrowing. It held a similar terrifying appearance to that of the great gyldygga, simply smaller and less extravagant. In mere seconds the creature bit into one of the guards, only to toss him meters away. The other tried to raise his shield, only to be tossed aside by it’s horns. This left the Luminary to fend for himself.

Unlike the guards, the great hero was able to dodge the oncoming volley of attacks. Claws scratching, teeth gnashing and horns thrusting. It truly fought like some sort of violent animal, which perhaps it was. The hero was able to fight back as well, his legendary sword easily able to repel the creature and his magic able to damage its metal exterior. It soon enough seemed as if the battle had been won, with the hero standing on high and the monster defeated on the ground. This unfortunately would not be the end.

Seconds before the Luminary could unleash the finishing blow, the beast suddenly began to expel magic from its mouth, making the hero freeze, covered in a purple aura. This wasn’t any typical type of magic... this was curse magic! The hero let out a few grunts of pain, but eventually succumbed to the curse, blacking out...

—-

When he awoke, it was bright. It was daytime. The luminary was rather confused, honestly. He seemed to be back in the castle. Not in the room he’d been sleeping in, but rather in a hallway. He could tell this due to the ornate architecture all around him and the type of carpet he was laying on. He wondered if he’d simply been sleepwalking and passed out. Had it all been a dream?

He sat up, trying to figure out exactly which hall he was in. It was a rather large hall... in fact, an extremely large hall. A hall that was far too big for this castle! He glanced around even more, seeing the massive doors and statues. Then he gasped and realized exactly what type of curse had been planted on him last night. One that stole his size! The legendary luminary was now reduced to the size of a common bug!

He began to get up to go and find help right away, but it seemed as if he was going to have company well before that. He could hear footsteps echoing through the halls towards him, getting closer by the second. It was...
13311.title: Little Luminary

choices: He landed off to the side and tumbled into another room
He landed nearby and started to follow her
He didn’t get away and ended up underfoot
133111.content:
Strolling through the halls was the princess of Heliodor herself, Jade. Despite her royal title, she was no fancy dress wearer. She was a skilled warrior who’d proven to be completely invaluable to the Luminary, in more regards than one. She was a fierce fighter who could knock the head off of a demon with a single kick, but was also able to sit down and simply talk with people. She tended to act cold on the outside, but the Luminary knew she wasn’t like that at all. It’s why he’d come to view her as a sort of big sister in his life. Just right now that big was quite literal

Each of her approaching steps would cause quite the shockwave of vibration and sound to shoot out at the tiny hero. Such a meaningless act of walking and yet it seemed so powerful to someone so small. Of course, her natural appearance was rather intimidating as well. She was a gorgeous woman, blessed with such a body. Her long black hair flowing behind her and her typical tight fitting green warrior’s garb certainly added to the look. But her eyes were always just so intense. And yet, the hero noticed one odd outlier of a detail.

For whatever reason, the princess had decided to roam the castle barefoot. It did make sense, considering she lived here. The typical rules did not apply to royalty, not that she liked to act like it. Jade was very humble and thus rarely took part in an special princess privileges. Of course, being comfy with no shoes was one of those privileges she didn’t mind taking.

———-

“Time for another lovely day of paperwork...” Jade mumbled as she strolled across the red carpeted halls. She was heading towards the office off near the throne room. After the war against the demons and monsters had ended, Erdea wasted no time in going back to normal. And with things normal, it meant plenty of work for the kingdom’s leaders. Jade may not conduct herself as a princess, but she wasn’t one to shy on responsibilities. Thus, she was ready for a day of work.

She didn’t detest paperwork per say, far from it. However, it certainly wasn’t adventuring with her friends. She did long for that thrill of exploration and discovery as she’d done before. But now wasn’t the time for that, at least not for her. Even so though, she’d make this as enjoyable as she could. When she’d woken up, she’d taken a nice, warm bath. And when she headed out, she’d left her boots behind. She did live the feeling of the thick carpet against her bare soles. Not to mention how much for comfy and free it felt...

————

At first the Hero simply stared at her quickly approaching monolithic form. How could he not? She was beautiful! From her intense eyes all the way down to her bare feet, which he took an extra moment to stare at. She had long soles, long toes and not much width in either. They were also very smooth and very soft looking. Truly the elegant feet of a princess. Elegant feet that were about to trample him down into the carpet. His brain soon kicked in again and the luminary began to run.

It wouldn’t be enough though, as just one of her slow steps covered so much more ground that his highest speed in the same amount of time. Soon enough, she was right above him. Jade lifted a leg above him, unaware of the tiny hero. Her foot cast a shadow over him, completely blocking out the light from above. He knew he couldn’t get away from her, so in a last ditch effort, he jumped...
133111.title: Princess Jade

choices: He saw nothing and followed her in
He saw Serena walking around nearby
A ball was being set up in the throne room? (Or something else)
1331112.content:
Despite his size, he managed to jump pretty far. He tumbled into the ground just to the side of her foot, narrowly avoiding being squished beneath it when she stepped down. At least it was a soft landing thanks to the carpets floors. He watched as the same sole that almost crushed him raised up and went forward. It really was such a harmless, innocent act for her. But it could have devastating effects on him at this size. And knowing how easily harm could come to him, the Luminary decided that his primary goal now should be getting back to normal size no matter what.

He thought it over for a few moments, before decided to chase Jade as best he could. It was unlikely he could figure this out on his own, so going to his friends for help seemed like his best bet. Only problem was keeping up, as the giantess was so much faster than him. If he had any mana left, he could cast accelerattle, but the curse had drained him of that.

———

After what felt like an hour of running, both him and Jade had reached the destination. She was heading into her office off to the side of the throne room. The luminary was exhausted, but kept going. He’d been able to handle dark lords and ancient evils, he could handle keeping up with big sis.

Before he went into the office though, he glanced around to see if the coast was clear, or if he had other options. After all, the office door was heavy. There was no going back if he went in there...
1331112.title: Following Big Sis

choices: He tried climbing up the desk
13311121.content:
As expected, nothing was really around. It was morning in the royal castle after all, the throne room was bound to be completely empty. So with nothing for him there, the little luminary followed along the princess into the office room.

It was like most of the other rooms in the palace, ornate, plenty of red and gold. But also some beautiful wooden furniture, most notably the grand desk that Jade planned to use to work. There was plenty of papers already stacked on it, so she was definitely going to be here a while. Which gave the hero a perfect opportunity to grab her attention. The only question was how to go about it

———

Jade sat in her seat with a sigh, her generous backside sinking into the cushioned seat. Today she’d basically just be filling out a bunch of rebuilding permits. People needed approval from the royal family to build anything within the capital after all. Jade didn’t particularly approve of that rule, but the law was the law. “Time to get started... hopefully I can finish before the afternoon...” She mumbled to herself as she picked up her feather pen and began to sign papers. She was playing with her feet as she did so...
13311121.title: Coast is clear

14.content: I know nobody likes choice chapters, but we wanna keep things organized around here
14.title: Pokémon

14311.content:
It was midnight in the Alola region as not many was out at these hours, though nobody was exactly Gladion at the moment. The boy was camping out in a simple tent as per usual with him looking up at the ceiling in thought, his usual shoes on the ground next to him, revealing the fact that his feet were bare. It was a good thing that nobody or his Pokemon was out near him right about now since his body carried quite the odor from not being able to shower on a constant basis.

His Pokeballs were also beside him just in case that he was to be forced into a confrontation, but however something was soon to be set into motion that would see the emo boy thrown into an uncanny adventure. A sound of glass being broken had alerted Gladion who looked at the opening in surprise, seeing the outside world glow white as he hurried outside, forgetting his shoes and Pokeballs in his haste, "What's going on? Is it an Ultra Beast emerging?" He questioned himself looking around in confusion as he felt a sort of suction pulling on him as he saw the Ultra Wormhole, the vacuum drawing him in as he tried to dig his heels into the grass but due to the fact that being barefoot tends to limit his options, things weren't good for Gladion as he yelled fearfully as he was pulled into the wormhole and disappeared into it, and with its prey in its clutches, the wormhole closed as quickly as it appeared.

Gladion drifted in the expanse of the Ultra Space, being pulled against his will, into a world that isn't like his own, and by that we mean the alternate universes of Pokemon.

Starting with...
14311.title: An Ultra-sized Adventure!

choices: Gladion tortures them with his feet.
Gladion wastes no time and crushes the Grunts to then figure out what's going on
143111.content:
People of Viridian City were on edge as the course of the last few days were pretty tense, there was an sudden explosion of Team Rocket Grunts attacking their establishments and stores, seemingly emboldened by the number of new recruits that have been coerced into joining them, it was such a day like this that there was a bunch of Team Rocket grunts robbing a store as they laughed and hauled their stolen goods into the truck, cash, TMs, HMs, the works as they chuckled and laughed to themselves as their haul was going well until they heard the loud sounds of glass breaking as they were on alert as the sky opened up to reveal a large Ultra Wormhole in the sky.

"What the heck is that?" One Grunt asked out loud in disbelief as they saw the swirling portal in the sky and more importantly, what was going to come out of it as Gladion came out as he fell on his butt, the only thing that didn't seem to match up was that he was somehow much bigger than his normal size, about 200ft tall as the ground trembled and shaked beneath his butt, as his flailing barefoot fell onto a parked car, his heel crumpling it like a flat disk with his weight while the grunts were thrown to the ground as he groaned in dismay at the rough landing, rubbing his butt.

"That could've been better...huh?" He asked himself as he looked around to see a rather unfamiliar city around him as Gladion sat on the ground, confused and at a loss as to where exactly he was, he didn't get to travel to Kanto yet, but he did see some of it on TV, this was Viridian city he assumes, and as he heard some yelling coming from below, that the people before his feet was actually a group of Team Rocket Grunts.

Said Grunts in particular wasn't having much of a fun time either as the Pokemon Trainer's feet were wafting an unbearable foot odor onto them, making them cough and choke on the strong musk as he flexed his sweaty toes idly as he scrutinize on what he should do, he needs to get home but he doesn't feel inclined to let these guys get off the hook and do whatever they want.
143111.title: The Takedown of Team Rocket!

info.brief_description: Just a macro/micro kink interactive I decided to make just for fun. Hope for additions!
info.description:
Another size kink interactive on this site, but I decided to get specific with the genre. Some will do a specific game and some will just say all. So I went with a middle ground and got a specific game genre, which thankfully is the one with the best characters ;)

As for rules and stuff, I’m pretty lax. You can do male or female characters, growth or shrink, almost any kink. Pretty much whatever you want. If there’s something I happen to feel doesn’t fit, I will remove or edit it though

Two paragraphs minimum for additions and try to keep your grammar at least somewhat decent. If you don’t think you can do that or simply aren’t in the mood for it, send me a message and I’ll consider writing a chapter for you in exchange for some points

Anyways, hope you all enjoy and do feel free to add. Foot related chapters are encouraged~

Any characters added here belong to their respective owners btw
